channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLscienceAndDiscovery
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLscienceAndDiscovery, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Johns Hopkins scientists grow a mini human brain that lights up and connects like the real thing
item.description: Scientists at Johns Hopkins have grown a first-of-its-kind organoid mimicking an entire human brain, complete with rudimentary blood vessels and neura...

item.title: Scientists just cracked the code to editing entire chromosomes flawlessly
item.description: A group of Chinese scientists has created powerful new tools that allow them to edit large chunks of DNA with incredible accuracy—and without leaving ...

item.title: NSF to invest in new national network of AI-programmable cloud laboratories

item.title: Crushing vs. Slashing: New skull scans reveal how giant dinosaurs killed
item.description: Tyrannosaurus rex might be the most famous meat-eater of all time, but it turns out it wasn’t the only way to be a terrifying giant. New research show...

item.title: Innovative traineeships prepare the next generation of STEM leaders in AI, quantum, biotech and more

item.title: This star survived its own supernova and shined even brighter
item.description: In a spectacular image captured by the Hubble Space Telescope, the spiral galaxy NGC 1309 glows with cosmic elegance and hides a strange survivor.

item.title: Scientists reexamine 47-year-old fossil and discover a new Jurassic sea monster
item.description: A new long-necked marine reptile, Plesionectes longicollum, has been identified from a decades-old fossil found in Germany’s Posidonia Shale. The rema...

item.title: NSF announces $100 million investment in National Artificial Intelligence Research Institutes awards to secure American leadership in AI
item.description: The investment will accelerate open innovation, empower an AI-ready workforce and strengthen U.S. global competitiveness...

item.title: Statement from NSF Chief of Staff Brian Stone, performing the duties of the NSF Director, on the White House AI Action Plan
